plot: One of the few remaining drone repairmen assigned to Earth, its surface devastated after decades of war with the alien Scavs, discovers a crashed spacecraft with contents that bring into question everything he believed about the war, and may even put the fate of mankind in his hands.

m.role: Cool Old Guy: Malcolm Beech is this. His first scene is him smoking a big cigar and somewhat hammily interrogating and giving exposition to a captured Harper. He also mentions having fought on the war and having survived the devastation of Chicago. His biggest desire is down there in Foreshadowing.
Shirtless Scene: Jack gets three (one is the Two-Person Pool Party scene mentioned below).

f.role: Olga Kurylenko's character in Oblivion (2013) is one of these. She exists in the film solely for the purpose of getting Tom Cruise's character to remember his past and become a hero. She's so disposable that Morgan Freeman (oh right, his character has a name—but face it, he's Morgan Freeman) is willing to leave her to be killed by robots, just to test whether or not Tom Cruise will decide to save her.
Girl in a Box: Julia Rusakova  later Harper kicks things off when her escape capsule lands on Earth and Jack investigates.
Oblivion (2013): Julia Rusakova  later Harper kicks things off when her escape capsule lands on Earth and Jack investigates.

Woman Scorned: Victoria doesn't betray Jack when he brings Julia back to the tower, but she does when she catches the two sharing a moment through the Bubble Ship's camera. When Jack explains that Julia is his wife, she rats them out to Sally.

name: Oblivion
